jparsec.graph

Class CreateChart3D

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.graph.CreateChart3D
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseWheelListener, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener

    public class CreateChart3D
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, java.awt.event.MouseWheelListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener
    A class to create 3d charts using JMathPlot visualization library. Some features implemented in the other charts are not available here, but it is possible to use the 3d features of the library. You may consider using CreateSurface3D class instead, since visualization is much better.

    A 3d chart created with this class can be rotated and zoomed with the mouse. The chart can be moved inside the window showing it by dragging with both buttons of the mouse.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getIntensityAt

        public double getIntensityAt(double x,
                    double y,
                    java.lang.String legend)
                      throws JPARSECException
        Returns the intensity at certain position using 2d spline interpolation.
        Parameters:
        x - X position in physical units.
        y - Y position in physical units.
        legend - The legend of the series, must be a surface.
        Returns:
        The intensity.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.
